cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to slow, then turn NNW tonight and NNE on Wednesday, crossing the eastern Gulf and tracking toward Florida’s Big Bend before moving NE across southeastern Georgia and off the GA/SC coast into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through southeastern Georgia and coastal South Carolina/Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (≥39 mph) possible, peak probability 16 % around 72 h (Thu night–Fri morning)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 2–4 ft possible along the Georgia barrier islands around the time the center moves offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain possible with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk in coastal GA drainage areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands Thursday night and Friday
